extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the importing and exporting of CSV files

    Liam Edwards, Alexander Rozsa

      • fileChooser

        public static java.lang.String fileChooser(boolean fileExport)
        Opens a window and returns the file path of the selected file.
        Parameters:
        fileExport - : whether to set for export (true) or not (false)
        Returns:
        file path if approve (yes, OK) is chosen. null otherwise.

      • readItemProperties

        public static void readItemProperties(java.lang.String filePath)
                               throws CSVFormatException
        Reads the Item Properties from the given filePath provided via the GUI
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the file to be read
        Throws:
        CSVFormatException - if something goes wrong

      • readManifest

        public static void readManifest(java.lang.String filePath)
                         throws CSVFormatException,
                                DeliveryException
        Reads the manifest from the given filePath provided via the GUI
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the item to be read
        Throws:
        CSVFormatException - if an invalid truck type is given
        DeliveryException - if an item is somehow invalid

      • readSalesLog

        public static void readSalesLog(java.lang.String filePath)
                         throws CSVFormatException,
                                StockException
        Reads the sales log from the given filePath provided via the GUI
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the item to be read
        Throws:
        CSVFormatException - if the format of the file is wrong
        StockException - if an item is somehow invalid

      • exportManifest

        public static void exportManifest(java.lang.String filePath)
                           throws StockException,
                                  CSVFormatException
        Exports a manifest for all items that need to be reordered
        Parameters:
        filePath - for the file to be exported
        Throws:
        StockException - if an item is somehow invalid
        CSVFormatException - if the manifestWriter fails to close
